title: Introduction to HTML
content: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard markup language used to create web pages. It provides the structure of a website using elements, tags, and attributes.
questions: What is HTML?
Difference between HTML, CSS, and JavaScript?
What are HTML tags and elements?

title: HTML Document Structure
content: An HTML document has a standard structure: <!DOCTYPE html>, <html>, <head>, and <body>. The head contains metadata, title, and links, while the body contains visible content.
questions: What is the purpose of <!DOCTYPE html>?
Difference between <head> and <body>?
What is the role of <meta> tags?

title: HTML Headings and Paragraphs
content:
Headings

to

define headings of different importance.

defines paragraphs. Proper use of headings improves readability and SEO.
questions: Difference between <h1> and <h6>?
How to create multiple paragraphs?
Why are headings important for SEO?

title: HTML Text Formatting
content: HTML provides tags for text formatting: <b>, <strong>, <i>, <em>, <mark>, <small>, <del>, <ins>, and <sub>/<sup>.
questions: Difference between <b> and <strong>?
Difference between <i> and <em>?
What do <sub> and <sup> do?

title: HTML Links
content: The <a> tag creates hyperlinks. The href attribute defines the link target. Links can be internal, external, mailto, or download links.
questions: How to create an internal link?
How to open a link in a new tab?
What is a mailto link?

title: HTML Images
content: The tag embeds images. Attributes include src, alt, width, height, and title. Use alt for accessibility and SEO.
questions: What is the purpose of the alt attribute?
Difference between width and height attributes?
How to add a tooltip to an image?

title: HTML Lists
content: HTML supports ordered lists <ol>, unordered lists <ul>, and description lists <dl>. Lists contain <li> items or <dt>/<dd> for description lists.
questions: Difference between <ol> and <ul>?
How to create a nested list?
What is a description list?

title: HTML Tables
content: Tables display tabular data using <table>, <tr>, <td>, <th>, <thead>, <tbody>, <tfoot>, and <caption>. Use colspan and rowspan to merge cells.
questions: Difference between <td> and <th>?
How to merge cells horizontally or vertically?
What is the purpose of <caption>?

title: HTML Forms
content: Forms collect user input using <form> with elements like <input>, <textarea>, <select>, <option>, <button>, <label>, and <fieldset>. Attributes include action, method, name, and placeholder.
questions: Difference between GET and POST methods?
How to create a dropdown list?
Why is the <label> element important?

title: HTML Input Types
content: Input types include text, password, email, number, date, color, checkbox, radio, file, range, and hidden. Each type provides built-in validation and UI.
questions: Difference between checkbox and radio input?
How to create an email input with validation?
What is the use of the hidden input type?

title: HTML Audio & Video
content: Use <audio> and <video> tags to embed media. Attributes include controls, autoplay, loop, muted, and source <source>. Formats include mp3, mp4, ogg, and webm.
questions: How to autoplay a video?
What does the controls attribute do?
How to provide multiple sources for a video?

title: HTML Semantic Elements
content: Semantic elements like <header>, <footer>, <main>, <section>, <article>, <aside>, <nav>, and <figure> provide meaning and improve accessibility and SEO.
questions: Difference between <div> and <section>?
What is the purpose of <aside>?
Why are semantic elements important?

title: HTML Meta Tags
content: Meta tags provide metadata about the HTML document. Common tags include charset, viewport, description, keywords, and author. They improve SEO and responsive design.
questions: What does <meta charset='UTF-8'> do?
How to make a webpage responsive with meta tags?
What is the purpose of meta description?

title: HTML Iframes
content: <iframe> embeds another HTML page or external content. Attributes include src, width, height, frameborder, allowfullscreen, and sandbox.
questions: How to embed a YouTube video using iframe?
What is the purpose of the sandbox attribute?
Difference between inline and block iframes?

title: HTML Entities
content: HTML entities represent reserved characters like <, >, &, ", ©, ®, and non-breaking spaces  .
questions: How to display < and > symbols in HTML?
What is   used for?
Difference between © and ®?

title: HTML Accessibility
content: Use ARIA roles, alt text, labels, and semantic HTML to improve accessibility for screen readers and users with disabilities.
questions: What is the purpose of the alt attribute?
How to make forms accessible?
What are ARIA roles?

title: HTML APIs
content: HTML APIs provide interfaces for additional functionality like drag-and-drop, geolocation, local storage, and canvas drawing.
questions: How to use localStorage in HTML?
What is the purpose of the canvas API?
How to get the user's geolocation?

title: HTML Best Practices
content: Write semantic, valid, and accessible HTML. Use meaningful IDs and classes, avoid inline styles, and include meta tags for SEO and responsiveness.
questions: Why use semantic HTML?
What is the importance of alt text?
Why avoid inline styles?

title: End-to-End HTML Guide
content: This JSON covers HTML from beginner to advanced topics, including structure, elements, forms, media, semantic HTML, accessibility, APIs, and best practices.
questions: Review all HTML topics and practice coding examples.
Build a webpage combining multiple HTML features.
Explain semantic HTML, accessibility, and media embedding in your own words.
